language.label: English
language.data: Search for keywords within the Lucee Administrator
The following settings are specific to the CFML dialect. This settings have no influence on the Lucee dialect.
Define the URL where Lucee gets its updates. Typically "https://www.lucee.org"
Apply the latest patch for your version. After the update has been installed Lucee will be restarted, all sessions will be cleared and you have to login again.
A patch {available} is available for your current version {current}.
For details go to our {a}Bug Tracking System{/a}
Remove all installed patches or only latest.
There is no patch available for version {current}
You can patch Lucee in order to receive the latest bug fixes and improved version.
Define where Lucee gets its patches. Lucee will restart automatically after the update in order for the changes to take effect.
Define how Lucee will be patched. "Automatic" means that Lucee searches automatically for updates once a day. "Manual" means that you can update Lucee only manually here.
Currently no update available for your version
Snapshots are generated automatically with every push to the repository, when all bundled test cases pass successfully. Snapshots are NOT recommended for production environments.
Pre releases a preview on upcoming releases. This version are in testing to get releases as soon they pass the testing process.
Releases are heavily tested and are recommended for production environments.
Upgrade or Downgrade snapshots and a release available for your current version {version}
Upgrade or downgrade your current version.
Versions came from custom URL given by the user
Upgrade or downgrade your current version.
There are currently no {type} available for your version.
Upgrade or Downgrade the version by selecting from the drop-down box below.
You cannot downgrade below {min-version} because your lucee.jar has bundled this version. To go below this version you need to replace your lucee.jar with an older version.

To downgrade your version below {minVersion} you need to replace your lucee.jar with an older version one you can download {url}. This is because the lucee.jars always bundles a version itself and it will always use at least that version.
All of the extensions are installed / Unable to connect to the update server to get the list of Available Extensions. Please check your Internet Connection.
Unable to connect to the update server to get the list of Available Extensions. Please check your Internet Connection
List SSL Certificates for a specific Host or install them.
There is no Certificate available from this host.
Missing value for text input field "host"
Add all Non CFML Source Templates as well (.js,.css,.gif,.png ...).
Add all CFML Source Templates as well (.cfm,.cfc,.cfml).
Add all Component Source Templates as well (.cfc).
Make this mapping web-accessible (i.e., accessible via a browser or remote HTTP call)
Name of the archive file (ra or ras), (absolute or relative to the webroot)
Sets where Lucee-files will first be searched
Sets whether the compile process should be aborted on errors
Here you can edit a certain mapping or create a Lucee archive out of an existing one.
Generate a Lucee archive (.lar) from an existing mapping
Compile all cfm and cfc files inside the mapping
Please enter a value for the resource (row
Please enter a value for the archive name (row

Please note, that only pages processed by Lucee are aware of these mappings (cfm, cfml, cfc). If you want to use files not processed by Lucee for these special mapping directories, you have to add virtual mappings to these directories to your application server.
Path of the resource to map (absolute or relative to the webroot)
Search for custom tags in subdirectories.
Please enter a value for the archive name (row
Search in the caller directory for the custom tag
component path is cached and not resolved again
Please enter a value for the resource (row
Directories that Lucee checks for Custom Tags.
These are the extensions used for Custom Tags, in the order they are searched.
Missing the name for the new Mapping, this name is used when you deploy a Lucee Archive (.ra,.ras) based on this Mapping.
The name is used as identifier when you automatically import a Lucee Archive build based on this Mapping.
Directory path where the custom tags are located.
File path to a custom tag Lucee Archive (.ra or .ras).
Defines where Lucee does looks first for a requested custom tags
When does Lucee checks for changes in the source file for an already loaded custom tags
The custom tag settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
The gateway settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
The ORM settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
define the access for reading data
You can define additional directories where file access is allowed
With CFX tags one can load Java classes which might have full access to the local hosts system. This might be a potential security risk to the hosts system
Here you can define the access rights for the settings that can be overridden in the "web administrator".
The cache settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
This tag is used to execute a process on the local hosts system
Define the General Access for administrator and tag cfadmin
define the access for writing data
Settings that have an effect on how Lucee code interacts with the host environment
Tags and Functions that might be a potential risk to the host system

Defines how Lucee can interact with the local filesystem in a web context.
- none: allows no access to the filesystem at all
- local: allows only access to the filesystem within the webroot
- all: allows full file access on the hosts filesystem
The settings (regional,component and scope) can be changed in the "web administrator"
The scheduled task settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
The mail settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
With the tag CFObject and the function CreateObject you can load Java objects. If disabled, you only can create objects of type "component"
It allows the settings in the administrator to be synchronized with other Lucee contexts
The settings for the cfx tags can be changed. The globally defined CFX tags defined in the "server administrator" can be used as well.
Here you can define the access rights that will be used as a default for all web contexts. If allowed, you can overwrite some of the settings in the corresponding "web administrator".
The debugging settings can be changed in the "web administrator"

Define the access rights for the different web contexts (webapps). Under the "general" tab you can define default rights for all web contexts that do not have a specific definition in the "individual" tab.
Defines how many datasources can be added in the "web administrator".
Define the security settings for a specific web context (webapps).
Allows adding, removing and updating of mappings in the "web administrator".
Allows access to Java methods and properties from the Lucee code (Example: stringValue.substring(2,5)). Allowing access to Java methods and properties might be a potential security risk
This tag can be used to import JSP and Lucee tag libraries
Security settings for a specific web context. You can edit or delete these contexts.
The search settings can be changed in the "web administrator"
With the tag CFRegistry you have full access to the registry of the local hosts system
Default character used to read templates (*.cfm and *.cfc files)
Default character set for output streams, form-, url-, and cgi scope variables and reading/writing the header
Specify the default server character set
Specify the default server character set
Default character set for reading from/writing to various resources
Please enter an individual error template.
In case of an exception, should individual status codes be returned? Untick to always return 200 status code.
Template that will be invoked in case of an error. This setting can be overridden by the tag CFError.
Template that will be invoked in case of a missing error. This setting can be overridden by the tag CFError.
There is an update {update} available for your installed version {installed}.
URL to the Extension Provider incl. path
URL to the Extension Provider (Example: http://www.myhost.com)
These applications are not yet installed on the system.
Can't uninstall. Install.cfc is missing. Please uninstall the application manually.
Please read the following license agreement carefully.
Can't uninstall. The uninstall method throws the following exception [{message}]. Please uninstall the application manually.
These applications are already installed on the system.

This Extension is already installed in the Server Administrator, you have 2 options, you can overwrite it for the current web context by installing it here as well or you can change it in the Server Administrator that will affect all Web Contexts.
If you downloaded an extension, you can add the extension here.

You have not uploaded a file!
Please first choose a file.

Because you did not agree with the license, the extension was not installed.
In case you installed the extension before, you will need to uninstall it, if you do not wish to agree with it's license anymore.
The file could not be uploaded.
There is no config.xml file available in the extension!
The Config xml file within the extension could not be parsed
The Config xml file within the extension does not contain the necessary [info] section within the [config] tag.
There are currently no {type} extensions available for your version.
There are currently no {type} version available for this extension.
Please review the documentation for creating Lucee Extensions.
The required field [config.info.$key$] does not exist within the Config xml file of the extension.
The required field [config.info.$key$] does not contain a value within the Config xml file of the extension.
The field [config.info.type] within the Config xml file contains an invalid value. Only [web, server, all] are supported.

You are trying to install a $type$ Extension into the $admintype$ Administrator...
Do you want to go to the $type$ Administrator?
There is an error with the extension you uploaded
Go back to the previous page
Extension installed in the Server Administrator
Minimal Lucee Version needed for this Extension.
You need at least the Lucee {version} to install this Extension
Choose the version you would like to install.
Update or downgrade your already installed version.
There is no extension available with name

This extension is not provided by the Lucee Association Switzerland and does not neccessarily follow our guidelines. This extension is not reviewed by the Lucee Association Switzerland. For any sugestion to improve the Extension or any issue you encounter, please contact the author of the extension directly.
the path to the Admin.cfc is missing
When calling "<Buttons.downloadArchive>", the archive on the remote client will be created but the download ignored, In this case you shouldn't include remote synchronization.
Define the clients that will be synchronized with the current administrator.
Define Access to Remote Client, the Password and the Security Key, the Security key is provided by the Remote Client itself
Define for what the Remote Client is used
The Administrator password for the remote client is missing
Password for the access to the remote Lucee Web Administrator
Password for the access to the remote Lucee Server Administrator
The remote client URL is missing
The label for the remote client is missing
Proxy Settings should be used for connection
List of failed tasks. The tasks listed in green will be re-executed. The ones in red have failed all attempts of execution and wont be executed again.
There are currently no open tasks
This task has been executed <tries> times. There are <triesleft> tries left
Even after <tries> tries, this task couldn't be executed properly
The security key for the remote client is missing
Password for the remote Web Administrator
Password for the remote Server Administrator
Connection to the Remote Client, URL (with Port) and HTTP Access
Here you can define clients, which will synchronize their settings with the ones of the current administrator
In case this Web Administrator is to be synchronized by another server, you have to enter the security key below in the distant definition of the remote client.
Please enter the key of the remote clients. You can find it under Remote security key in the administrator of the remote clients
Maximum number of parallel threads used to execute tasks at the same time, fewer threads will take longer to execute all open threads, more threads will add more load to the system.
Here you can define several default settings for the application context. These settings can be overridden with the tag cfapplication or the Application.cfc.
You can define the scopes to be checked individually
Please select the type of the listener
When the URL parameter [RequestTimeout] is passed in the URL obey it
Looks for the file "Application.cfc/Application.cfm" from the current up to the webroot directory.
Looks for the file "Application.cfc/Application.cfm" in the current directory and in the webroot directory.
When a request is called no other initialization template will be invoked by Lucee
Modern handling. Lucee only looks for the file "Application.cfc"
Sets how requests are handled and which templates are invoked by default.
Defines how Lucee handles long running request.
This setting defines how the system handles concurrent requests.
Maximal concurrent request must be an integer
The maximum concurrent requests that the engine allows to run at the same time, before the engine begins to queue the requests.
The time a request is held in the queue. If the time is reached the request is rejected with an exception. If you have set 0 seconds the request timeout is used instead.

Sets the amount of time the engine will wait for a request to finish before a request timeout will be raised. This means that the execution of the request will be stopped. This setting can be overridden using the “cfsetting" tag or script equivalent.
Settings that affect the execution of a request.
The configuration of Script protect, secures your system from "cross-site scripting"
Script-protect checks in all scopes for external data (cgi,cookie,form,url)
Mixed handling. Lucee looks for a file "Application.cfm/OnRequestEnd.cfm" as well as for the file "Application.cfc"
Defines where Lucee looks for the files "Application.cfc/Application.cfm". In case of type "none" this setting is meaningless.
Please select a value for script-protect
Looks for the file "Application.cfc/Application.cfm" only in the webroot .
Classic handling. Lucee looks for the file "Application.cfm" and a corresponding file "OnRequestEnd.cfm"
Looks for the file "Application.cfc/Application.cfm" only in the current template directory .
Please enter a value for the corresponding password.
Please enter a value for the mailserver.
Missing value for mail log file
Please enter a value for the port.
Port of the mail server (for example 587).
Please enter a value for the default encoding
Mail server connections (Connections from Server Administrator)
This is the default encoding used
Mail server host name (for example smtp.gmail.com).

You can define more than one mail server connection. When sending an email, Lucee tries to send the mail with the first defined mail server. If the send operation fails, Lucee will continue using the next mail server in the list.

These connections have been created in the Server Administrator and are shared with ALL web contexts. You cannot modify these mail servers in the Web Administrator. You can define more than one mail server connection. When sending an email, Lucee tries to send the mail with the first defined mail server. If the send operation fails, Lucee will continue using the next mail server in the list.
Create a new mail server connection.
Edit an existing mail server connection.
Please enter a value for the host name
Please enter a value for the username
The field "hour" must contain a positive integer
The field "second" must contain a positive integer
The field "minute" must contain a positive integer
Please enter a valid path for the collection
Results {startrow} - {endrow} of about {recordcount} searched in {recordssearched} Records
Please enter a path to be indexed
Here you can manage, create, populate and delete search collections. By default, Lucee uses Apache Lucene as the search engine.
Please enter a name for the collection
Please enter the file extensions to be indexed
Search relative to the caller directory for the component
Please enter a value for the "dump" template
component path is cached and not resolved again
Defines how components will be handled by Lucee.
Please enter a value for the resource (row
Please enter a value for the archive name (row
Define the accessor for the data-members of a component. This defines how variables of the "this" scope of a component can be accessed from outside of the component.
the following package definition is imported into every template.
Additional Resources that Lucee checks for Components.
Defines whether a component has an independent variables scope parallel to the "this" scope (CFML standard) or not.
Define the component settings that will be used as a default for all web contexts.
Please enter a value for the auto import field

If there is no accessible data member (property, element of the this scope) inside a component, Lucee searches for available matching "getters" or "setters" for the requested property. The following example should clarify this behaviour. "somevar = myComponent.properyName". If "myComponent" has no accessible data member named "propertyName", Lucee searches for a function member (method) named "getPropertyName".
Search for CFCs in the subdirectories of the "Additional Resources" below.
If you call a component directly this template will be invoked to dump the component. (Example: {url})
Please enter a value for the base/root component
Search the component in the mappings defined, this include the implicit mapping "/", that points on the webroot

Every component that does not explicitly extend another component (attribute "extends") will by default extend this component. This means that every component extends this base component in some way. Every change on this Component needs a restart from Lucee.
Missing the name for the new Mapping, this name is used when you deploy a Lucee Archive (.lar) based on this Mapping.
The name is used as identifier when you automatically import a Lucee Archive build based on this Mapping.
Directory path where the components are located, this path should not include the package.
File path to a components Lucee Archive (.lar).
Defines where Lucee does looks first for a requested component
When does Lucee checks for changes in the source file for an already loaded component
Please enter a value for the field password
The old password is to short, its length must be at least 6 characters
The new password is to short, its length must be at least 6 characters
reset the Password of the selected Web
Set the default password for all web administrators
Please enter a value for the old password
Please enter a value for the new password
The new password and the reentered password are not the same
The new password for the administrator
Please enter the word you see in the image above.
Please enter the word you see in the security code image.
Use Captcha in the login to make sure the form is submitted by a human.
Allow "Remember Me" functionality, so a new logging is not necessary when the user session was terminated.
Sets the delay between login attempts. This is a global setting for all user requests.
Change the password for this administrator
File the memory usage will be stored to

If set to "yes" Lucee logs the debug information you have selected below. you can see the log result at the end of every request, if a debug template is defined or under Debug/Logs in this administrator.
Please enter a value for the debug template
This template is used for formatting the debugging output
Sets whether the memory usage should be logged
Please enter a value for the timezone
Select this option to log the query usage information.
Select this option log template activity for all cfm and cfc templates.
Select this option to log the database activity for the SQL Query events and Stored Procedure events.
Select this option to log all exceptions raised for the request.
Select this option to log trace event information. Tracing lets a developer track program flow and efficiency through the use of the CFTRACE tag.
Select this option to enable output produced with help of the tag cfdump and send to debugging.
Select this option to show timer event information. Timers let a developer track the execution time of the code between the start and end tags of the CFTIMER tag.
Select this option to show timer event information. Timers let a developer track the execution time of the code between the start and end tags of the CFTIMER tag.
Select this option to log all accesses to scopes, queries and threads that happens implicit (cascaded).
Minimal Execution Time that Lucee outputs the debugger information of a request.
Path that should not be outputted, seperated path by line break.
Configure the size of the debug logs.
Only Outputs records where the path match the following pattern.
Detailed information about a single Request
Enable certain logging options for Lucee
You need to enter the virtual name
You need to enter the physical path
you need to define the label for the debug template
there is no debug template defined
you have no access to manipulate the debug settings

A comma separated list of strings of ip definitions. The following patterns are allowed: - * including all ips - a single ip, like ""127.0.0.1"" or ""0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0"" - an ip with wildcards like ""127.0.0.*"", in this case all ips between ""127.0.0.0"" and ""127.0.0.255"" are valid - an ip range like ""127.0.0.1-127.0.0.10"", in this case all ips between ""127.0.0.1"" and ""127.0.0.10"" are valid You can define IPv4 or IPv6 IPs, an IPv4 can not be converted to an IPv6 and visa versa.
Readonly debug templates are generated within the ""server administrator"" for all web instances and can not be modified by the ""web administrator"".
list of existing debug templates defined.
define a debug template, to show the debug information at the end of a request, defining a template is not necessary to log the debug information.
Create a Template for a specific IP Range
These are all the OSGi bundles (jars) available locally.
This page allows to set the logelevl and location of every single log.
Allow to add or remove Mappings in the Application with help of the function restInitApplication/restDeleteApplication.
Please enter a value for the physical resource.
Sets the amount of time Lucee will keep the session scope alive. This behaviour can be overridden by the tag cfapplication.
timeout must have an Integer Value
This setting defines if the scopes URL and Form will be merged together (CFML Default is false). If a key already exists in Form and URL Scopes, the value from the Form Scope is used.
Sets the amount of time Lucee will keep the application scope alive. This behaviour can be overridden by the tag cfapplication.
When a variable has no scope defined (Example: #myVar# instead of #variables.myVar#), Lucee will also search available resultsets (CFML Standard) or not

Depending on this setting Lucee scans certain scopes to find a variable called from the CFML source. This will only happen when the variable is called without a scope. (Example: #myVar# instead of #variables.myVar#)
- strict: scans only the variables scope
- small: scans the scopes variables,url,form
- standard (CFML Standard): scans the scopes variables,cgi,url,form,cookie
JEE Sessions allow to make sessions over a cluster. When you change this setting you will lose your current session and you must make a new login
Here you can define the settings for how Lucee handles scopes.
By default session management can be enabled. This behaviour can be overridden by the tag cfapplication.
Enable or disable client cookies. This behaviour can be overridden by the tag cfapplication.
Defines how the local scope of a function is invoked when a variable with no scope definition is used.
the local scope is always invoked
the local scope is only invoked when the key already exists in it
Sets the amount of time Lucee will keep the client scope alive.
You can define the scope settings that will be used as default for all web contexts here.
By default client management can be enabled. This behaviour can be overridden by the tag cfapplication.
Enable or disable domain cookies. This behaviour can be overridden by the tag cfapplication.
Defines whether the CGI Scope is read only or not.
The CGI Scope cannot be manipulated.
The CGI Scope can be changed like other scopes.
This setting is only possible in the Lucee Server Administrator.
Lucee has a complete support for null, including "null" literal. Find more details in the Lucee Wiki.
Lucee has only a partial null support.
Lucee compiler settings, this affects how the Lucee Compiler parses the source code. Changing this settings flushes all existing class files and triggers a recompilation.
Convert all struct keys defined with "dot notation" to upper case. Example: sct.dotNotation --> keyname: "DOTNOTATION" sct[""bracketNotation""] --> keyname: "bracketNotation"

Keep all struct keys defined with "dot notation" in original case (according to the "bracket notation"). Example: sct.dotNotation --> keyname: "dotNotation" sct[""bracketNotation""] --> keyname: "bracketNotation"

If set, Lucee suppresses whitespace defined between the "cffunction" starting tag and the last "cfargument" tag. This setting is ignored when there is a different output between this tags as white space.
Press the button above to clear the Page Pool cache. This cache is used to cache the template object classes (loaded source code).
Press the button above to clear the component path cache.
Press the button above to clear the custom tag path cache.
Press the button above to clear the {name} cache.
Different Cache and Performance settings to improve overall performance
Return the Lucee version in the response header
Enable compression (GZip) for the Lucee Response stream for text-based responses when supported by the client (Web Browser)
Simple whitespace management - every whitespace character that follows whitespace is removed
Smart whitespace management - every whitespace character that follows a whitespace is removed, but whitespace inside the tags: <code>, <pre> and <textarea> is kept
Suppress content written to response stream when a Component is invoked remotely. Only works if the content was not flushed before.

If true - the output written to the body of the tag is buffered and is also outputted in case of an exception. Otherwise the content to body is ignored and not displayed when a failure occurs in the body of the tag.

When checked, any requested files found to currently reside in the template cache will always be inspected for potential updates. For sites where templates are updated during the life of the server or within request.

When checked, any requested files will be inspected only once for potential updates within a request. For sites where templates are not expected to reflect updates within the same request, this minimizes file system overhead.

When checked, any requested files found to currently reside in the template cache will not be inspected for potential updates. For sites where templates are not updated during the life of the server, this minimizes file system overhead.
Removes all white spaces in the output that follow a white space
Define a global proxy, that will be used in several tags by default (cfhttp,cfftp,cfmail ...)
Please enter a value for the proxy port
URL of a proxy server eg."http://myproxyserver.org/"
The video components are installed on your system.
The video components are installed but they can not be executed properly.Just switch to the Lucee Server Administrator, in order to repair it:
Download video components by an URL
The necessary video components are already installed on your system.
The video components are installed but they can not be executed properly:

For the tag cfvideo/cfvideoplayer OS specific video components are required. They are not bundled with Lucee because the size of the software would increase a lot and because some codecs may not be redistributed, although their use is not prohibited. Therefore you can download these components directly from a provider and upload them with the form below.
The video components (ffmpeg.zip) are uploaded directly over the form and copied into Lucee (no installation). As a source you can use e.g. {provider}

A manual installation can be made like follows: Open the url {provider} and download the corresponding file ffmpeg.zip for your operating system ({OS-Name}). Then copy this file (do not unzip it) into the directory {directory}. If you can not find a file for your operating system, just contact us.
The video components are downloaded automatically from the remote server and copied into Lucee (no installation).
Defines the time when the Task is executed monthly
Password to access the URL if it is protected by authentication
The tasks displayed in red have expired and will no longer start.
This task is executed once a day.
By setting this flag, the execution of the task will be paused.
Here you can add, modify, run and delete scheduled tasks
Sets, whether the response of server will be stored in a file or not
When there is a Proxy Server between the Lucee Server and the called URL, you can define the Proxy Servers Setting here to access the URL
Defines a date within the task should be executed the last time.
Defines the date when the task should be executed the first time.
This task is executed once a month.
Defines the date and time when the task should be executed.
Defines a date within the task should be executed the last time.
The address of the proxy server (example: my.proxy.com)
Please enter a value for the URL of the task
Timeout in seconds. Defines how long a task will wait for the response of the server called by the URL
With the following settings you can define, if Lucee should store the result of the url invocation and where Lucee should store this result
Name of the new task (this name must be unique)
Interval in that the task will be executed
File the output is stored to
Password to access a proxy if it is protected by authentication
URL that will be invoked by the task
Defines the time when the Task is executed weekly
Port of the URL to call (HTTP Default: 80)
This task is executed once a week.
Define the time when Lucee stop to executed the task within every day.
This task is executed in a certain interval.
Define a date when the task should be executed the last time.
Please enter a value for the name of the task
Username to access a proxy if it is protected by authentication
The current date/time of this Lucee context is:
Defines the time when the Task is executed daily
Defines the date when the task should be executed the last time.
Defines the time when Lucee starts to executed the task within every day.
Execution interval of the new task
This task is executed only once at a specific date and time.
Username to access the URL if it is protected by authentication
Defines the date when the task should be executed the first time.

These datasources have been created in the Server Administrator and are shared with ALL web contexts. You cannot modify these datasources in the Web Administrator, but you can override them by creating your own datasource with the same name.
Readonly gateway instances are generated within the "server administrator" for all web instances and can not be modified by the "web administrator".
no access to create gateway instances
There is no Gateway Type Available
Define if this connection will be the default cache connection, the default cache connection is used when no cache name is explicit defined
List of all existing gateways for this environment
Host name where the database server is located
Validate the connection before use (only works with JDBC 4.0 Drivers)
Define a time in minutes for how long a connection is kept alive before it will be closed
Define how long an idle connection will be kept alive, before being closed
Define how long a connection will be kept alive, before being closed
The port to connect the database
Restricts the maximum number of simultaneous connections at one time
Datasources created here are available for ALL web contexts to use. The settings for these datasources can only be modified in this Server Administrator area.
Allow using this datasource for client/session/log storage.
Preserve single quotes (") in the SQL defined with the tag cfquery
define how long Stored Procedures Meta Data are stored in cache
Missing the datasource type you are looking for? Click {link}here{/link} to find an extension for the datasource type you require.
Missing the datasource type you are looking for? Click {linkServer}here{/link} to search for an extension to install for all web contexts or {link}here{/link} for the current context only.
You can also set this in the Application.cfc as follows
You can do this in your code yourself as follows
Some of this settings can be done in the Application.cfc as well
Please enter a name for the datasource
Name of the database to connect

When you define a date as a string (not with cfqueryparam) inside cfquery, there is normally no timezone information with it and the date string is based on the locale timezone. Therefore the database will interpret this date string based on it's own timezone. If the timezone of your Lucee instance and your database is different, this can lead to problems. Because of that Lucee now allows you to define a timezone for a specific datasource definition. Be aware that you should only define a specific timezone, if you are a 100% sure that this timezone is used on the database server and it is different from the timezone of the Lucee instance. This setting can be overwritten by the cfquery attribute "timezone".
Enable binary large object retrieval (<abbr title="binary large object">BLOB</abbr>)
Enable long text retrieval (<abbr title="character large object">CLOB</abbr>)
Export the settings of this Web Context as Application.cfc Template, of course this includes only settings possible in Application.cfc.

Time server that returns the current time. If set, this time will be used within Lucee instead of the local server time. (Example: swisstime.ethz.ch, time.nist.gov)

You can define regional settings that will be used as a default for all web contexts here. These settings have no direct effect on the current instance. Lucee lets you set your own individual locale, timezone and timeserver.
Lucee lets you set your own individual locale, timezone and timeserver.
Define the desired time zone for Lucee, this will also change the time for the context of the web.

If you have any questions about Lucee please take a look at the documentation in the first instance.
If you think you've found a bug, please take the time to report it via our bug tracking system.
A complete guide to developing an application with Lucee from start to finish.
Lucee Community is intended to be used by low budget business applicants. Except for some few limitations the Community Version offers the entire language range of Lucee.
The Enterprise Version of Lucee is the biggest and most comprehensive version intended to be used in a larger context.
The latest news from Lucee is always posted on our blog.
The mailing list is the focus of our community support program - help for users by users.
The REST Servlet is not configured in your environment!
You are running Lucee with Java
Lucee does not formally support this version of Java. Consider updating to the latest Java version for security and performance reasons.
Java 7 has been End-of-Life'd since April 2015.
You can label your web contexts here, so they are more clear distinguishable for use with extensions etc. The default label of a web context is the MD5 hash of its webroot.

For many organizations and individuals, the security of a formal paid support contract is a necessity and we're pleased to offer four standard packages as well as the flexibility to create a custom package should your needs go beyond our standard offerings.
The Develop Version is a version, addressing those users who are most likely to apply it in order for assembling CFML application . The version though is prohibited to be used commercially.
Lucee is available in four different editions, adapted to the different areas of application and budgets.

The Professional Version offers the full language range of Lucee, no restriction to the use of any feature has to be expected. With the Professional Version several web contexts can be used on one server, the number of web contexts however is limited by the licence price.
Lucee, the CFML engine - free, open source and easy to use. This Web Administrator is provided in order to customize your web context.

The Server Administrator allows you to install updates and patches for your Lucee installation and to restart the engine with a mouse click. You can configure new web contexts and define restrictions and configurations per web context individual.

Here you can define the default settings for the ORM Configuration, this settings can be overwritten in the Application.cfc with the struct "ormsettings".

Specifies whether Lucee should automatically generate mapping for the persistent CFCs. If disabled, mapping should be provided in the form of .HBMXML files. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.autogenmap=true]
Specifies the default Catalog that should be used by ORM. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.catalog='db']

Specifies the directory that should be used to search for persistent CFCs to generate the mapping. If cfclocation is set, Lucee looks at only the paths specified in it. If it is not set, Lucee looks at the application directory, its sub-directories, and its mapped directories to search for persistent Components. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.cfclocation='...']

Lucee ORM can automatically create the tables for your application in the database when ORM is initialized for the application. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.dbcreate='none']
Setting this value does not change anything in the database schema.
Setting this value creates the table if it does not exist or update the table if it exists.
Setting this value drops the table if it exists and then creates it.
Specifies whether ORM Event callbacks should be given. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.eventHandling=false]
Specifies whether ormflush should be called automatically at request end. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.flushatrequestend=false]
Specifies whether the SQL queries that are executed by ORM will be logged. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.logSQL=false]

Specifies whether the generated Hibernate mapping file has to be saved to file system. If enabled, the Hibernate mapping XML file is saved with the filename ""CFC name"".hbm.xml in the same directory as the CFC. If any value of savemapping is specified in CFC, it will override the value specified in the ormsetting. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.savemapping=false]
Specifies the default Schema that should be used by ORM. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.schema='sch']

Specifies whether the database has to be inspected to identify the missing information required to generate the Hibernate mapping. The database is inspected to get the column data type, primary key and foreign key information. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.useDBForMapping=true]

Path to the SQL script file that gets executed after ORM is initialized. This applies if dbcreate is set to dropcreate. This must be the absolute file path or the path relative to the application.The SQL script file lets you populate the tables before the application is accessed. This setting can be overwritten in Application.cfc as follows [this.ormsettings.sqlscript='...']
Snapshots are generated automatically with every push to the repository, when all bundled test cases pass successfully. Snapshots are NOT recommended for production environments.
Releases are heavily tested and are recommended for production environments.
This Update Provider (release.lucee.org ) returns only stable versions. The versions found here are deeply tested. This source is recommended for production environments.

This Update Provider (preview.lucee.org) returns public preview versions. Versions are tested, but not as deeply as stable releases. This source could be used for production environments. Please use caution.

This Update Provider (dev.lucee.org) returns ""Bleeding Edge"" versions. Usually only a small amount of testing has been performed on these versions. This source should NOT be used for production environments.

Lucee allows you to define your own update provider by simply defining the URL to the rest service providing the necessary data. Please consult the Lucee Documentation on {url} for more details on how to define a custom update provider
server {url} failed to return a valid response.

Your JAR's are out of date. In order to update your JAR's, please click the button below. This might not work if you do not have a proper internet connection. If the download did not succeed, please download the latest JAR's from our download section and update the JAR's manually. You have to restart your Servlet engine, so that the changes take effect.
Path to the Component that is listening to the Gateways action
Hier sehen Sie eine Übersicht alle Settings welche Einfluss auf das Verhalten von Lucee haben, sie können diese nach vordefinierten kriterien anpassen
Mit diesem Wert werden alle Settings so gesetzt, dass sie möglichst dem CFML2009 Standard entsprechen und mit Implementationen anderer Hersteller kombatibel sind.
Mit diesem Wert werden alle Settings so gesetzt, dass Lucee so streng wie möglich mit der Umsetzung des Code ist.
Mit diesem Wert werden alle Settings so gesetzt, dass sie eine möglichst schnelle Ausführung des Code erlauben.
Overall timeout for the connections established to the mail server.
Idle timeout for the connections established to the mail server.
Destination file where the log information get stored.
Log level used for the log file.
If enabled the mails are sent in a background thread and the main request does not have to wait until the mails are sent.

This setting can be changed on page "Services/Taks". Maximum number of threads that are executed at the same time to send the mails, fewer threads will take longer to send all the mail, more threads will add more load to the system.

Time in seconds that the Task Manager waits to send a single mail, when the time is reached the Task Manager stops the thread and the mail gets moved to unsent folder, where the Task Manager will pick it up later to try to send it again.
